title: Design Thinking-Based Integrated Business Management Workshop: Business Text Analysis and Strategic Expression Development

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate theoretical background and practical experience required. Foundational grammar/vocabulary skills for business report writing and presentations
context.additional_context: Project-based learning environment utilizing design thinking to solve real business problems. Emphasizes team collaboration in smartphone-centric limited-technology settings. Learners enhance expressive and reading comprehension skills by practicing the conversion of market research data analysis into clear, persuasive business texts

learning_goals: Students apply the 3I model (Inspiration-Ideation-Implementation) to analyze real business scenarios, extract key vocabulary from market research texts, and derive creative solutions.
Learners integrate analytical and exploratory thinking through the design thinking process to propose decision-making strategies and present them in a structured business report format.

Learners, in 4-member teams, analyze at least three domestic/international market research datasets to identify one market opportunity, complete a prototype business model canvas (9 blocks) reflecting the opportunity, achieve an average score of 4 or higher on peer evaluation (5-point scale), and create persuasive presentation materials for investment acquisition.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
